comment: Ratio test for convergence of a complex infinite series. If the ratio ` A ` of the absolute values of successive terms in an infinite sequence ` F ` is less than 1 for all terms beyond some index ` B ` , then the infinite sum of the terms of ` F ` converges to a complex number. Equivalent to first part of Exercise 4 of [Gleason] p. 182. (Contributed by NM, 26-Apr-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2014.)
